Ad Text:
We Dream. We Design. We Deliver.

Join hummgroup, one of Australasia's most successful and enduring non-bank financial services institutions. We specialise in fast, easy finance with a market-leading range of business asset finance, credit cards and point of sale payment plan solutions designed around the core needs of today's businesses and retail consumers. Come join our team and be a part of our next chapter of innovation and growth.


What's so exciting about this role?

The Data Engineering role is a multi-faceted function. You will work on strategic projects, provide trusted advice regarding data use and distribution, help to shape hummgroup's modern data platform by engineering robust, reusable, and optimised pipelines, and take responsibility for the hygiene of these solutions.

Your primary driver is to enable our organisation to extract the most value possible from our data assets, striving for efficiency by aligning data systems with business goals.


What Does An Average Day Look Like?

No day is average at humm but here's an idea of what you can expect to do in this role:


Partner across the business to understand data-sharing, enrichment, analytics and ML needs, and develop high‑value, reusable data products that support multiple applications.
Engineer and optimise data pipelines, including ingestion, modelling, transformation and enrichment, using modern tools (e.g., Snowflake, ADF, DBT Cloud) to ensure performance, scalability and reliability.
Ensure data quality, consistency and fitness for purpose by integrating data from multiple sources, understanding data lineage and authority, and applying strong governance, security and access controls.
Design and maintain robust data architectures that enable predictive/prescriptive modelling and advanced analytics, while continuously improving platform efficiency, reliability and outcomes.
Monitor and troubleshoot pipelines, proactively identifying issues and implementing improvements to minimise failures and performance bottlenecks.



Who will thrive in this role?

This role is ideal for someone with a strong background in cloud data engineering, data pipeline development and data modelling, particularly in a complex financial services data environment.


We're also looking for someone who brings:



Strong SQL skills and experience working in a modern cloud environment (Azure or AWS), including data modelling and pipeline development (must have).
Experience with cloud‑native tools (e.g., Azure Data Factory, AWS S3/Glue, AWS DMS, DBT Cloud) and understands how to build and optimise data workflows.
An understanding of CI/CD practices and orchestration for deploying data solutions.
Practical experience with Python or scripting, plus good knowledge of data governance, security and best‑practice engineering.
You're collaborative, agile in your ways of working, and able to turn complex data requirements into scalable, reliable solutions.
Experience in implementing data governance principles (preferred)
Exposure to streaming tools like Kafka or Kinesis and familiarity with financial or customer analytics environments. (Nice to have)



Working at hummgroup

We embrace flexible working arrangements, ensuring a genuine work-life balance and a fun, vibrant inclusive culture that embraces diverse perspectives and values the unique contributions of each of our team through our behaviours Curious - Adaptable - Tenacious - Accountable - Respectful.

We invite candidates of all gender expressions, ethnicities, ages, and other culturally diverse groups to apply. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment process and welcoming and supportive environment where all our people can thrive.

If this sounds like the opportunity, you have been looking for then apply today!

About AIM

AIM Defence is a fast-growing deep-tech startup developing high-power laser systems to protect people from weaponised drones. We operate at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and defence, with a focus on practical outcomes, not bureaucracy. We are seeking an experienced Control Systems Researcher to design, implement, and optimise advanced control systems, ensuring that all outputs are rigorous, accurate, and actionable.

The Role

Design, implement, and troubleshoot advanced control systems, including gimbals.

Mentor less experienced engineers and potentially take a leadership role.

Solve problems through rigorous analysis, not trial and error.

Communicate technical thinking clearly to the team, preferably using plots.

Ensure all designs are mathematically sound, reproducible, and operationally reliable.

Key Responsibilities

Develop advanced control system algorithms, including model predictive control.

Hands-on work with motors, embedded systems, and gimbal platforms.

Lead and mentor team members, supporting professional development.

Communicate complex technical concepts logically and effectively.

Integrate systems into operational platforms safely and reliably.

Skills & Experience

Experience building gimbal control systems mandatory.

Expertise in advanced control systems and model predictive control.

Proficient in C++.

Leadership potential and mentoring capability.

Humble, collaborative, and analytical mindset.

Able to solve problems using math and analysis rather than trial and error.

Requirements

Australian Citizen with NV1 Defence Security Clearance.

Willingness to work onsite.

Why Join AIM?

Influence development of cutting-edge defence systems.

Work in a collaborative, high-performance engineering team.

About AIM

AIM Defence is a fast-growing deep-tech startup developing high-power laser systems to protect people from weaponised drones. We operate at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and defence, with a focus on practical outcomes, not bureaucracy. We are seeking an experienced Systems Engineer to produce high-quality documentation for defence procurement and international partner integration, ensuring that all outputs are rigorous, accurate, and actionable.

The Role

Reporting to the Co-CEO, you will:

Work with the Project Manager and tech leads to gather, validate, and analyse system data.

Identify gaps in data and collaborate to fill them.

Produce technical documentation for defence integration and international partners.

Work in parallel with engineering teams without disrupting workflows.

Interact with customers and partners as part of integration and delivery projects.

Key Responsibilities

Produce comprehensive technical documentation for defence and partner requirements.

Liaise with tech leads to clarify technical data and ensure accuracy.

Identify missing or inconsistent data and drive corrective action.

Communicate technical concepts clearly to internal and external stakeholders.

Support engineering teams without distracting core development work.

Skills & Experience

Defence systems engineering experience is mandatory.

Startup experience advantageous.

Tertiary qualification in systems engineering preferred but not required.

Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.

Ability to work autonomously and maintain focus on outcomes.

Requirements

Australian Citizen with NV1 Defence Security Clearance.

Willingness to work onsite.

Why Join AIM?

Contribute to large-scale defence procurement projects.

Play a key role in documentation and integration with global partners.

Job Overview  

Collaborating with team members and stakeholders to design data integration solutions that meet business requirements, utilising Microsoft Azure tools such as Azure Data Factory and SQL.
Develop, implement, and maintain ETL pipelines to ensure efficient and secure data transfer between various systems, adhering to best practices for data processing and transformation.
Design and maintain data models, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and availability while considering scalability and performance optimisations.
Implement data validation and quality checks to identify and rectify data anomalies, errors, and inconsistencies within integrated systems.
Continuously monitor and optimise data integration processes to enhance performance, reduce latency, and minimise resource consumption.
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data integration solutions, including technical specifications, data flow diagrams, and operational procedures.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, and system analysts, to understand data requirements and ensure integrations align with business objectives.
Troubleshoot and resolve data integration issues, working collaboratively with the team to implement effective solutions and prevent recurrence.
Stay updated on emerging technologies and industry trends related to data engineering and integration, applying this knowledge to improve integration processes and tools. 
Job Requirement    

Strong Microsoft Azure Data Factory skills and experience
Proven experience in data engineering, including data integration, ETL processes, and data modelling.
Strong SOL skills and experience with data warehousing concepts.
Knowledge of data governance, security, and compliance best practices.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
Effective communication skills for collaborating with technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
Job Location

Canberra / Sydney 
 
If you are interested in the above job opportunity, please apply through the links provided or please feel free to contact Newman for more details.

0404 331 242

Location: Waurn Ponds, South West Coast VIC
Ad Text:
Li-S Energy is seeking a Senior Manufacturing & Project Engineer with a strong manufacturing background to expand our production capabilities and drive the development, commissioning, and optimisation of battery cell manufacturing equipment.

This is an opportunity to join a well-funded, ASX listed Australian technology company and play a key role in the commercialisation of world-leading battery technology.

About us

Climate change demands action, and the future of transportation needs cleaner, lighter power solutions. At Li-S Energy, we're not just keeping up; we're driving the change with groundbreaking lithium sulfur technology. Our vision extends far beyond electric vehicles (EVs), encompassing drones, electric aircraft, and countless other innovations shaping tomorrow's world.

At Li-S Energy, we're not your average company. We combine the stability and resources of an ASX-listed company with the agility and excitement of a trailblazing start-up. We also have some seriously cutting-edge technology at our fingertips, with our advanced pouch cell production line in the largest battery dry room in Australia. This unique blend lets us make a real impact on the world, pushing the boundaries of battery technology while enjoying the collaborative, fast-paced environment of a start-up culture. But to truly revolutionise the world, we need passionate individuals like you.

The opportunity

Reporting to the CTO, you'll work in our purpose-built facility at Deakin University's Waurn Ponds campus, supporting development of cutting-edge battery cells.

This newly created role brings together the critical functions of production development, engineering project coordination, and manufacturing operations leadership. It is designed for an experienced engineering professional who can operate across pilot-scale development, production engineering, and operational management to support Li-S Energy's growth and commercialisation pathway. This role is highly cross-functional, working closely with R&D, Quality and Operations teams.

Working within a high-tech, ASX-listed organisation, this role supports both day-to-day operations and long-term strategic objectives.


Key Responsibilities

Production Development & Engineering

Develop, assemble, and commission pilot-scale production equipment.

Maintain, service, and improve production and ancillary equipment.

Troubleshoot complex electromechanical, control, and process issues.

Produce CAD models, technical drawings, process documentation, and equipment specifications.

Identify and implement process improvements for yield, quality, and throughput.




Project Engineering & Coordination

Liaise with external consultants as required (engineering, environmental, financial, etc.).

Review and provide input on process flow diagrams, cost estimates, equipment lists, and design packages.

Prepare progress reports, technical summaries, and documentation for leadership.




Manufacturing Operations Leadership

Oversee daily production activities, ensuring safety, efficiency, and quality.

Monitor key KPIs such as yield, cycle time, scrap rates, and equipment uptime.

Support R&D-to-production technology transfer and new product introduction.

Coordinate cross-functional teams including Quality, Supply Chain, and Engineering.

Ensure compliance with ISO standards, QMS requirements, and regulatory obligations.




Safety, Quality & Documentation Systems

Develop and maintain safe working procedures in collaboration with the OHS Advisor.

Lead traceability and document control system development to support scale-up.

Implement audit trails, version control, change management, and digital documentation tools.

Ensure alignment with ISO 9001 and develop internal quality frameworks.




Team Development & Leadership

Train and mentor production staff and junior engineers.

Foster a culture of continuous improvement and proactive problem-solving.

Support recruitment, performance management, and capability development.




Qualifications & Experience

Essential

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Mechatronic, or related engineering field.

5+ years of experience in manufacturing, production engineering, or pilot-scale development.

Demonstrated experience operating and troubleshooting complex equipment.

Strong skills in CAD, data analysis, and documentation.

Proven ability to lead multi-disciplinary engineering or production activities.

Strong understanding of QMS, ISO 9001, and process documentation systems.

Candidates must have current Australian work rights at the time of application.




Advantageous

Experience with battery production, advanced materials, or precision manufacturing.

Experience implementing traceability systems, MES-lite solutions, or digital quality systems.

Lean or Six Sigma training.

RP.Eng. registration or ability to obtain.




Key Competencies

Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

Excellent communication and stakeholder management.

Ability to manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.

Hands-on technical aptitude with a continuous improvement mindset.

Leadership qualities that foster teamwork, accountability, and safety.




Why Join Us?

Work on cutting-edge battery technology with global impact.

Contribute to the scale-up of world-leading lithium-sulfur technology.

Enjoy flexibility, autonomy, and significant growth opportunities.

Be part of a collaborative, high-performance team pushing the boundaries of energy storage.

How to Apply

To apply for the position please submit your resume and other relevant information via the 'Quick apply' link.

For more information about careers at Li-S Energy, visit lis.energy/careers

Job Title: AI & ML Engineer / Permanent / up to $160,000 + super / Sydney
Ad Text:
AI & ML Engineer / Permanent / up to $160,000 + super / Sydney

About the company
Our client is a large, data-led organisation operating across digital and technology-enabled services in Australia. With a strong focus on innovation and growth, they invest in advanced analytics and AI to improve products, customer experiences, and long-term business outcomes.

About the role
Reporting into a senior data leader, this role designs, builds, and maintains AI and machine learning solutions embedded within core products. Working closely with product, analytics, and business teams, the role delivers scalable, interpretable models aligned to commercial and customer objectives.

Benefits

Full time, permanent opportunity - $150k - $160k + super
Work on production-grade AI and ML products
Exposure to modern AI, ML, and generative AI tooling
Collaborative, cross-functional environment
Ongoing learning and career development support
Duties / Key responsibilities

Develop, deploy, and maintain machine learning and AI models for customer and product use cases
Translate complex datasets into scalable, business-aligned AI solutions
Collaborate with product owners, analysts, and stakeholders across the business
Implement model monitoring, versioning, and retraining processes
Ensure models are reliable, interpretable, and fit for regulated environments
Skills and experience

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, AI, or similar
3+ years’ industry experience in machine learning or data science
Strong Python and SQL capability, with experience using Pandas and NumPy
Experience with ML frameworks such as scikit-learn and PyTorch
Strong understanding of generative AI, LLMs, prompt engineering, and RAG frameworks
Experience with model lifecycle management tools such as MLflow
Confident communicator with strong stakeholder collaboration skills
Experience using GitHub or similar code repositories
Exposure to Databricks, cloud platforms, or insurance data is beneficial
If you’re interested
If you’re interested in this opportunity and feel you’re the right fit please click “apply” 

About Allura Partners
Allura Partners was founded to support private equity firms by placing C-Suites to lead, transform, and scale portfolio companies. Today, in addition to our proven private equity specialisation, we’ve become a trusted partner for major ASX-listed and private enterprises in Australia, offering executive search, recruitment, and business transformation. Known for integrity, reliability, and results, our expertise spans Executive Search, Accounting & Finance, Transformation & Change, and Technology & Digital. We connect businesses and top-tier talent, exceeding expectations and driving lasting impact.

AI & ML Engineer / Permanent / up to $160,000 + super / Sydney

About Aurizn

We are an Australian owned Defence Technology company pushing the limits to support Australian and allied forces deliver a more secure future.

Shape the world at Aurizn to make a real impact and join our team. A recognised Great Place to Work, Aurizn people are driven by our values; Think Clever, Always Deliver, Embrace the Unknown and Be Better Together.

With an industry-leading suite of benefits including ongoing training and growth opportunities, a variety of leave types, health and wellness offerings, flexible working and more, a career with Aurizn empowers you to perform at your best and push the limits for a more secure future.

Shape the world at Aurizn.

The Opportunity

Aurizn is seeking a Principal Data Scientist who is highly competent in Machine Learning and AI to plan, lead, and deliver strategic and complex machine learning system. This role combines deep technical expertise with technical leadership, stakeholder engagement, and contribution to organisational best practice and strategy.

Key Responsibilities Include:

Plan and lead the delivery of strategic, large, or complex AI and Machine Learning systems.
Ensure the quality, robustness, and operational performance of data-driven algorithms in production AI solutions.
Provide authoritative advice and solutions to complex technical problems in high-risk environments.
Identify and evaluate emerging AI/ML methods, models, datasets, and architectures, and communicate findings internally.
Act as a technical authority when engaging externally with clients, partners, and in public or professional forums.
Contribute to organisational strategy, standards, tools, and best practices for AI/ML, MLOps, and software engineering.

What We Are Seeking

Active NV1 clearance.
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related discipline, with postgraduate qualifications at a Master’s or PhD level is highly regarded.
Professional experience, ideally completed 8+ years of work experience or postgraduate research in implementing deployable algorithms for manipulating data
Hands-on expertise in Python, PyTorch, and modern AI/ML frameworks, with working knowledge of NLP, speech processing, LLMs, and agentic AI.
Strong communication, presentation, and stakeholder engagement skills, with experience operating as a technical authority.
Demonstrated technical leadership, including guiding teams, setting technical direction, and ensuring delivery quality are desirable.
Experience working in secure or regulated environments, with Defence industry experience desirable.
Experience working with competency frameworks is desirable.

Due to a requirement for Defence Clearance to undertake the duties of the role, Australian Citizenship is required.

We welcome applicants with diverse backgrounds. Please reach out to careers@aurizn.co if you have any particular needs that we can support you with throughout this process.

Company: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
Azure Data Engineer


Sydney or Newcastle, NSW
$150,000 incl. super
5+ year's experience

About the Role

We're looking for an experienced Azure Data Engineer to support and maintain enterprise-scale data pipelines in a production environment. This role is focused on ensuring the reliability, performance, and integrity of Azure Data Factory (ADF) pipelines across a multi-cloud data ecosystem.

You'll play a key role in monitoring data ingestion, resolving incidents, collaborating with cross-cloud teams, and ensuring data platforms meet SLA, security, and governance standards.

Key Responsibilities

Support, monitor, and troubleshoot Azure Data Factory pipelines in production
Manage data ingestion from Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, flat files, and web services
Track pipeline executions, SLA adherence, and proactively escalate issues
Perform incident analysis, implement fixes, and document root causes and resolutions
Validate data integrity across source and target systems post-execution
Automate alerts and notifications for pipeline failures and SLA breaches
Collaborate with AWS teams to support multi-cloud ETL workflows and SAS DW integrations
Participate in release management for new pipelines and enhancements
Ensure all operations comply with security, governance, and data standards

Skills & Experience

Strong hands-on experience with Azure Data Factory
Solid SQL skills and ETL troubleshooting experience
Experience integrating APIs and external data sources
Familiarity with AWS data platforms and cross-cloud operations
Knowledge of job scheduling, monitoring, and alerting tools
Proven background in production support and operational data environments

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Data Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field
5+ years' experience in ETL operations and production support
Azure Data Engineer certification (preferred)

Why Apply?

Choice of Sydney or Newcastle location
Work with modern Azure data platforms in a complex, enterprise environment
Opportunity to collaborate across cloud ecosystems and mature data operations

Category:
Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
About QBCC

The QBCC is Queensland's independent building and construction regulator, dedicated to educating, protecting and supporting both the industry and the community. Through fair, transparent and accountable regulation, the QBCC helps build confidence and strengthens one of Queensland's most vital industries.

This is a defining decade for the building and construction sector, with ambitious housing targets and the Olympic and Paralympic legacy ahead. The QBCC is responding with focus and ambition, modernising services, deepening relationships and building the internal capability needed to deliver at scale.

Central to this journey is a commitment to people. The QBCC is shaping a workforce that is inclusive, high performing and future ready. By fostering equity, diversity and wellbeing, and by creating safe and supportive workplaces, the Commission is ensuring its people can thrive while delivering outcomes that matter for industry and the community.

About the role

This position is based in Brisbane CBD and flexible work arrangements can be considered upon application, including working remotely at a regional QBCC office subject to availability.  If working from a regional office, regular travel to the Brisbane office may be required.

In this role you will play a crucial part in shaping the future of data and AI. You'll build powerful cloud‑native data science platforms, bring cutting‑edge ML models into production at scale, and craft the data products that unlock everything from predictive insights to natural language intelligence. You'll be the guardian of data quality and responsible AI, designing governance, metadata, and monitoring frameworks that keep systems trustworthy and compliant. You'll also champion modern engineering practices - automation, CI/CD, reusable ML components - while keeping high‑performance pipelines running smoothly. If you love driving innovation, influencing technical direction, and turning emerging technologies into real business impact, this is the kind of challenge that keeps your skills sharp and your work meaningful. Also, you will get the opportunity to work on greenfield projects.

*Please refer to the Position Description for the Key Outcomes and Accountabilities and Candidate Attributes for this role*

Why Join QBCC?

Generous 12.75% superannuation contribution with the option to salary sacrifice
Access to leave entitlements (with 17.5% leave loading) and accrual of flex time
Opportunities for career development, training and mentoring
A friendly, collaborative and supportive workplace culture
Modern office with excellent transport links

How to apply
If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your current resume and a cover letter (maximum two pages) outlining how your skills, knowledge and experience complement this role based on the Candidate Attributes outlined in the Position Description.

Referee checks 

It is recommended you seek approval when nominating a person as a referee. Referees should have a thorough knowledge of your work performance and conduct, and it is preferable to include your current/ immediate past supervisor.  

By providing the names and contact details of your referee/s you consent for these people to be contacted by the selection panel. If you do not wish the panel to contact your referees without your permission, please make this clear on your resume.

HRD Employer of Choice, Accredited Family Inclusive Workplace

Join a forward-thinking organisation that values new ideas and innovation.

Data#3 is seeking a Delivery Focused Data & AI Architect to join our Professional Services team. You’ll lead solution design for modern data platforms on Microsoft Fabric and Azure, working directly with customers to define architecture, shape approaches, and guide decision making. Alongside architecture leadership, you’ll implement key solution components as part of project delivery—ensuring what we design is delivered to a high standard.

This is a hands on consulting role suited to someone who enjoys solving complex problems, shaping modern data approaches, and engaging with customers to deliver practical, secure and well governed data solutions. This role suits someone who is equally comfortable building solutions, advising clients, and mentoring delivery engineers.

In this role you will:

Lead solution architecture across Microsoft Fabric and Azure data platforms, including ingestion, transformation, modelling, governance and analytics

Design and implement data pipelines, lakehouse architectures, orchestration patterns and platform configuration

Embed security, governance, lineage and data quality by design across all solutions

Produce high-quality architecture artefacts including HLDs, LLDs, data models, diagrams and decision records

Run discovery, technical assessments and facilitate customer workshops

Guide customers through solution options, risks, trade-offs and implementation approaches

Support pre-sales with solution input, estimates and technical guidance when required

About You

5–8+ years’ experience in data engineering, data architecture or analytics solution design

Strong consulting capability with experience delivering end-to-end data platforms

Hands-on experience designing, configuring and deploying Microsoft Fabric and Azure data components

Proven ability to implement governance, lineage, data quality and security-by-design

Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify complexity and influence decisions

Relevant certifications (DP-600, DP-700, DP-900) or willingness to obtain

Technical Skills:

Microsoft Fabric: OneLake/Lakehouse, Pipelines, Notebooks, Real Time Analytics, Event Streams, Power BI governance

Azure Data Platform: ADLS Gen2, ADF, Synapse (dedicated & serverless), Databricks, Azure SQL, Cosmos DB, PostgreSQL, Azure Monitor, Key Vault

Architecture approaches: Medallion/Lakehouse, ETL/ELT/ELTL, OLAP vs OLTP, data modelling, SLA/SLO design




Who is Data#3?

Data#3 is ASX200 listed and reported gross sales of $3 billion in FY25. Headquartered in Brisbane we have approximately 1,400 employees across 12 locations in Australia and Fiji.

We have been voted HRD's Employer of Choice for the last 10 years and named one of Australia’s Best Workplaces in Technology by Great Place To Work® in 2024

At Data#3, we value diversity, equity, and inclusion as key to a thriving workplace. We are committed to building a culture where everyone feels welcome, respected, and valued—and we encourage your application.

Data#3 will request as part of the recruitment process, reference checks, police checks and verification of your right to work in Australia.




REF: SACA113657

Who we are

EDMI Gas Pty Ltd, based in Dandenong South, specialises in providing, repairing, and maintaining gas and water measurement equipment. As part of the global EDMI smart metering group, we offer production of and services for industrial and domestic gas meters and support advanced utility solutions. 

 As the Associate Production Engineer, you will apply engineering techniques to improve gas and water meter manufacturing processes and products. You’ll provide technical support, operational insights, and continuous improvement expertise to help EDMI Gas & Water respond effectively to market demands while maintaining safe, efficient and cost‑effective operations. You will report directly to Senior Production Engineer with a dotted reporting line to the Technical Services, Quality and Risk Manager.




Your benefits

Generous Leave Entitlements: 5 weeks annual leave + diversity day to celebrate a birthday, religious occasion, or special occasion

Opportunity to purchase up to two additional weeks’ leave per year.

Monthly BBQ lunch and morning tea.

On site parking.

 

What you will do

Your day will be varied, and you will work closely with the Operations (Dandenong) teams. A typical day could see you:

Working with a multi- disciplinary team using lean principles to support the introduction of automation and improved production processes. 

Ensuring the continued safe operation and improvement of testing and operations equipment in a production environment. 

​Coordinating water meter upgrades and batch testing, including supervision of temporary staff. 

Coordinating the Return Merchandise Authorisation (RMA) process for water meters, liaising with the Stores Coordinator and the Sales Support Coordinator. 

Liaising with product suppliers to identify, investigate, and resolve quality-related issues.

​Supporting the Senior Production Engineer in maintaining equipment verification activities.

​Working with pneumatic and electromechanical controls and devices to design and build equipment in partnership with qualified trade staff.

Preparing engineering reports, developing CAD drawings and documenting technical processes both visually and in writing, for a Culturally and Linguistically Diverse (CALD) audience. 

​Supporting laboratory testing operations, ensuring correct machine testing and calibration. 

Auditing engineering related processes.

 

What you will bring

Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering (recognised in Australia) 

Relevant engineering experience, ideally in a manufacturing or similar environment 

​Some experience in high level language programming or PLC’s or HMI’s

​CAD experience

​Experience with sensors and instrument calibration would be highly regarded 

Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills. 

Proven ability to document technical processes for a Culturally and Linguistically Diverse (CALD) audience. 

​Ability to contribute to the upskilling of operations staff. 

​Demonstrated commitment to a safe and productive work environment. 

 Apply Now

At EDMI, we are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. We believe that our differences make us stronger and are dedicated to creating an environment where every individual, regardless of background, identity, or perspective, feels valued and respected. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and actively work to build an inclusive culture that promotes fairness, equal opportunity, and mutual respect.

For any questions, please email William Gaung, Senior Production Engineer at Ye.Gaung@edmi.com.au with your contact details, and he will be in touch.

Solution Architect – Aerospace, Defence & Manufacturing

Location: Boeing Australia (Melbourne with hybrid work options)

About the Role:


Boeing Australia is seeking a hands-on Solution Architect with 5-7 years’ experience to design and deliver integrated, scalable, and secure IT solutions across corporate and operational systems.

This role spans Payroll, HR, ERP, Engineering, Quality, and Manufacturing Systems, supporting Boeing’s aerospace and defence services environment.

You will apply Boeing’s Application Development & Sustainment methodology and enterprise architecture principles to drive digital transformation, system integration, platform development, and custom software solutions that align with business goals and compliance requirements.

Due to the International nature of the role and business as a whole, there may be the requirement to support after hours meetings and calls, however flexibility is encouraged. Some domestic travel may be required.

Key Responsibilities:

Design and develop fit-for-purpose, technically sound solution architectures that optimise business value, comply with Boeing’s architecture standards, and support digital transformation across corporate and operational systems.

Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to elicit, analyse, and document solution requirements, ensuring alignment with architectural principles and project objectives.

Lead feasibility studies and business cases, supporting solution implementation, testing, and transition to operations, while also developing current and future-state technical architecture documents.

Work closely with technical teams, including developers, to conduct proof-of-concept work, validate potential solutions, and establish new architecture patterns.

Apply deep ERP knowledge (Finance, HR, Supply Chain) and expertise in Engineering and Quality Systems to guide solution design and integration with business processes and data models.

Provide strategic guidance across diverse platforms and enterprise technologies, including cloud environments such as Azure/M365 and AWS, while supporting the development of long-term product and system roadmaps.

Identify and review existing application profiles to define upgrade and/or replacement paths, confirming and developing architectural documentation as needed.

Inform roadmaps for addressing application risks and support decision-making on solution architecture for current and emerging business requirements, with a focus on business risk remediation and lifecycle road-mapping.

Mentor development teams on architecture best practices, ensuring solutions meet security, scalability, and performance requirements, and contribute to the continuous improvement of architecture standards within Boeing’s Global IT community.

Participate in architecture compliance reviews and manage waivers in accordance with governance mandates.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience)

5-7 years’ experience as a Solution Architect or similar role, preferably in aerospace, defence, manufacturing, or other regulated industries.

Proven track record in planning, designing, developing, and implementing complex IT solutions involving system integration, platform development, and custom software.

Strong hands-on experience with cloud platforms (Azure/M365/AWS), ERP systems (e.g., Oracle eBusiness / SAP), and service management tools (e.g., ServiceNow)

Experience with Enterprise Cloud environments, governance frameworks and tooling

Understanding of Cloud Economics and FinOps concepts

Solid understanding of cyber and information security principles and their application in IT environments.

Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to develop innovative, practical solutions.

Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, capable of working effectively across business and technical teams.

Familiarity with enterprise-grade application development methodology or equivalent software development and sustaining frameworks.

Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience)

Relevant architecture certifications (e.g., TOGAF, AWS Solutions Architect)

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field

Experience working in Agile and DevOps environments is advantageous.

Boeing Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for both the defence, space and commercial aircraft manufacturing.

We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join a collaborative team on a hybrid contract basis in Melbourne. This is an exciting opportunity to work on complex, high impact data projects that directly support strategic decision making across the organisation.

Key responsibilities
Design and maintain Kimball-style dimensional data models, including facts, dimensions, conformed dimensions and SCDs.
Build and support ETL/ELT data pipelines to ensure data is accurate, timely and aligned with business requirements.
Work across a modern AWS-based data stack, including Lambda, Redshift, S3, and platforms such as Databricks, Snowflake and Power BI.
Develop and support integrations using enterprise ETL tools — ideally Matillion, though Oracle OWB/ODI experience is also highly regarded.
Continuously improve existing dimensional models and design new models to keep pace with evolving business needs.
Write and optimise SQL for data transformation, performance tuning and validation.
Prepare Source-to-Target (STT) mapping documents to support dimensional model implementation.
Partner closely with business and technical stakeholders to gather requirements, understand priorities and manage expectations.
Key skills and experience
Strong experience in data engineering and dimensional data modelling.
Hands-on experience with an AWS data stack (Lambda, Redshift, S3) and modern analytics platforms such as Databricks, Snowflake and Power BI.
Proven ability to design and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines, with Matillion preferred (Oracle OWB/ODI also considered).
Advanced SQL skills with a strong focus on data quality, validation and performance optimisation.

This large federal social policy agency manages rich, complex datasets to inform programs and services that improve outcomes for Australians.
 
You will join the Data Science Section, a high-calibre team of data scientists, analysts, and engineers, led by a new EL2 driving enduring, customer-focused AI and data products.
 
The team is pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, deploying platforms such as Gemini, Azure AI Foundry, Vortex AI, Hugging Face, PyTorch, llama-cpp, DSPy, and Unsloth.
 
The Opportunity

This is a chance to join a team at the forefront of AI experimentation within government.
 
You will have the opportunity to work hands-on building and testing proof-of-concept AI solutions, helping shape how the team transitions those capabilities into production delivery next financial year.
 
The team is operating in a start-small, prove-it, then scale model, experimenting across cloud and generative AI platforms while establishing the foundations for enduring products. Work currently underway or in the pipeline includes:

NLP-driven automation to replace manual processes across forms, documents, and workflows
Advanced analytics and modelling (including clustering, NLP, and digital twins) to understand sentiment, behaviour, and policy impacts
Applied generative AI, including pilots for image and video creation that have already demonstrated value
The Role

You will work as part of a multidisciplinary team delivering data science, AI, and cloud engineering solutions from concept through to early delivery.

Key responsibilities include:

Designing, engineering, and deploying data science and AI solutions in collaboration with data, digital, and business teams
Architecting and building cloud infrastructure (Azure, AWS or GCP) using Infrastructure as Code, with flexibility in how environments are set up
Delivering projects spanning data ingestion, ETL pipelines, exploratory analysis, NLP, generative AI, and self-service solutions
Rapidly prototyping engineering solutions for high-priority AI and data initiatives at proof-of-concept stage 
The Ideal Person

This role is deliberately broad and will suit one of two profiles. You may be a strong data engineer moving into AI, or an AI specialist with a solid data and engineering foundation. In both cases, you enjoy working hands-on in early-stage environments and helping teams move from experimentation to delivery.

This role will appeal to someone who enjoys filling gaps, complementing existing team capability, and contributing as an active delivery team member rather than operating as a standalone expert. Curiosity, comfort with ambiguity, and a willingness to research and test emerging technologies are essential.

Key skills and experience

Hands-on capability across Python, data pipelines, modelling or NLP, with the ability to work across both structured and unstructured data
Designing or working with cloud environments (Azure, AWS or GCP), ideally using Infrastructure as Code to enable flexible, scalable setups
Practical exposure to generative AI, including prototyping, prompt engineering, model evaluation, or working with open-weight models
Delivering data science, AI, or cloud engineering solutions in government or complex, multi-stakeholder environments
Strong communication skills, with the ability to translate business problems into technical solutions and explain value to non-technical stakeholders
Salary / Rate

This is a full-time contract commencing in March for an initial contract through to 30/6/26. There is the possibility of a 12-month extension.

The rate has not been specified; however, based on current market conditions, I would expect a range of $140/hr –$160/hr incl. Super, depending on skills and experience.

Australian Citizenship with existing AGSVA clearance is mandatory

We are an inclusive employer committed to fostering a diverse and accessible workplace. About us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation. As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world's most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.


About the opportunity:

As LMA continues to expand its Australian portfolio, we are growing our team of talented Verification & Validation (V&V) Engineers. In this role, you will help shape and mature a modern, digitally enabled V&V environment supporting complex engineering projects and Integrated Product Teams across our Integrated Air and Missile Defence, Maritime, and Aeronautics portfolios.

You will play a key role in delivering incremental system verification for major Defence programs, ensuring quality, compliance, and confidence in engineering outcomes. Working within a collaborative, cross-functional team, you will plan, coordinate, and execute system-level test activities that underpin capability assurance.

Key responsibilities include:

Own key V&V artefacts including the V&V Plan, Verification Cross Reference Matrix (VCRM), and Acceptance Test Plans and Procedures

Design and document the V&V digital thread, ensuring end-to-end traceability from requirements to test evidence

Plan, manage, and execute system-level verification activities across the engineering lifecycle

Build and maintain strong relationships with engineering teams and external stakeholders

Develop a deep understanding of system capabilities, architecture, and requirements to inform effective verification strategies

 

About you: 

​​​​​​​You bring a strong background in V&V or systems engineering within Defence or other complex technical environments. You value collaboration, structured problem-solving, and technical rigour, and you enjoy tackling verification challenges across multi-disciplinary engineering teams. 

To succeed in this role, you’ll bring: 

A degree in Engineering or equivalent relevant experience

Demonstrated experience in systems engineering, integration, and V&V on complex systems

Knowledge of one or more Defence domains: Command & Control, Command Support, or Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR)

Working knowledge of MBSE practices and tools (e.g., DOORS, Rhapsody, ETM)

Experience working in an Agile/Scrum engineering environment

An Australian NV-1 security clearance and ability to access/handle Export Controlled technology, data and information


How we reward and support you: 

When you join Lockheed Martin, you work on projects you won’t experience anywhere else.

We offer you a range of benefits built to suit you, no matter what stage of life you are in. 

Flexible work & Hybrid work options

Access to our online discounts program offering immediate discounts or cashback

A variety of leave options including Purchase Leave to support you and your family  

Additional benefits such as Annual Flu Vaccinations, Novated Leasing and Fitness Programs


Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance and employment may be contingent on the provision of further personal information including citizenship to ensure compliance with international export control legislation and regulations.

A Veteran-friendly Workplace:

Veterans are encouraged to apply. We highly value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and transitioning service members can contribute to our team. We are proud to be recognised as a Veteran Friendly Employer by the Australian Government.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Lockheed Martin Australia supports Equal Employment Opportunity and values diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, free of unlawful discrimination and is harassment free, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. By leveraging our employees' unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

As part of our endeavours to increase participation of Indigenous Australians, we welcome applications from all people, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone can thrive. If you are selected for this role, we would be happy to discuss any accommodations that will help you to be successful.

Job Title: Systems Engineer Opportunities - Defence and Advanced Technology Programs
Ad Text:
About Us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation. As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world's most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.


Systems Engineer Opportunities – Defence and Advanced Technology Programs

We’re expanding our engineering team and have new Systems Engineer openings across a range of advanced Defence and technology programs.

As a Systems Engineer, you’ll help shape next-generation capability by applying Model-Based Engineering (MBE) to design, develop and integrate complex systems. You’ll work closely with specialists, partner organisations and cross-functional teams to deliver solutions that strengthen Australia’s Defence and national security outcomes.

About the Role:

In this role, you will:

Analyse and transform system and sub-system requirements into detailed designs within an MBE environment.

Define and manage system interfaces, ensuring full traceability throughout the design lifecycle.

Conduct trade studies and optimise design solutions against performance, cost, and schedule considerations.

Produce and maintain technical artefacts — including design descriptions, requirements documents, and analysis reports.

Participate in design reviews and support project planning, stakeholder engagement, and engineering assurance activities.

Contribute to estimates, bids, and continuous improvement initiatives across programs.


About You:

You are a capable Systems Engineer who enjoys tackling complex technical problems and working in multidisciplinary teams. You’ll bring: 

Demonstrated experience across the systems engineering lifecycle, including requirements, design, integration, and verification.

Knowledge of MBSE approaches and tools such as MagicDraw, Rhapsody, Cameo or similar.

Experience working on complex systems, ideally within Defence or high-technology environments.

Strong analytical, modelling, and documentation skills.

A collaborative mindset with the ability to mentor or support junior engineers.


Why Join Us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, you’ll work on programs that push the boundaries of innovation, engineering excellence and mission capability. Whether you’re passionate about systems design, integration, digital engineering or model-based development, you’ll have opportunities to learn, lead and grow.

Be part of something bigger — help shape the future of Defence systems and advanced technology.

Apply now for one of our Systems Engineer opportunities.


How we reward and support you: 

When you join Lockheed Martin, you work on projects you won’t experience anywhere else.

We offer you a range of benefits built to suit you, no matter what stage of life you are in. 

Flexible work & Hybrid work options

Access to our online discounts program offering immediate discounts or cashback

A variety of leave options including Purchase Leave to support you and your family  

Additional benefits such as Annual Flu Vaccinations, Novated Leasing and Fitness Programs


Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance and employment may be contingent on the provision of further personal information including citizenship to ensure compliance with international export control legislation and regulations.

A Veteran-friendly Workplace:

Veterans are encouraged to apply. We highly value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and transitioning service members can contribute to our team. We are proud to be recognised as a Veteran Friendly Employer by the Australian Government.

By leveraging our employees' unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

Description

You'll work within a high-impact data and analytics team focused on improving reporting, data quality and operational decision-making through AI. A key part of this role is fine-tuning and optimising AI models, and integrating them into a modern cloud data platform built on Snowflake.

Build AI-driven workflows that enhance reporting and data processes

Develop and maintain Python-based data and AI pipelines

Work with large, complex datasets to improve data quality and accessibility

Collaborate with data, analytics and business stakeholders to identify AI opportunities

Contribute to best practices for AI governance, reliability and scalability

Profile

Hands-on experience working with LLMs / Generative AI
Strong SQL skills and experience working with Snowflake
Experience building or fine-tuning AI/ML models in production environments

Ideal Experience

Background as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer or AI Engineer
Experience deploying AI solutions into cloud environments

Experience working with reporting, analytics or enterprise data platforms
Experience in the mining or resources sector is highly regarded

Job Offer

Salary sacrificing
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Corporate discounts

About Brunel:

Brunel is a recruitment and flexible workforce solution provider which connects talented people with opportunities throughout Australasia and around the world. We specialise in highly skilled roles across a variety of technical, professional, trades and craft disciplines, pairing candidates with industry-leading projects and organisations on a contract, permanent or secondment basis.

Operating in Australasia since 1997, Brunel has major bases of operation in Perth, Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne and Port Moresby, which are further backed by the strength and reach of a truly global network spanning over 45 countries, 120 offices and 50 years of successful operation.

Brunel is proud to be equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander and female candidates.

Do you have questions?

If you have any questions or would like to discuss the details of this role, please contact Terence Gomes on t.gomes@brunel.net

Live Your Best Life!  Our benefits offer you access to deals, support and discounts to help you unlock the important things in Life – Health, Family, Recreation and Your Future with MinRes 


The opportunity

Join the dynamic AI team at MinRes as an AI Engineer, where you will play a pivotal role in transforming operations across our mining, logistics, and corporate environments. In this hands-on position, you will design, develop, and deploy scalable AI solutions to drive performance, safety, and productivity across the business.

You will collaborate seamlessly with data engineers, product owners, business partners and frontline teams to turn ambitious ideas into real-world, high-impact AI outcomes. Your focus will be on building AI products that are not only technically robust but also adopted and valued at every level.

If you are passionate about experimentation and delivering practical, scalable solutions that make a genuine difference, we want to hear from you.
This position will commence as a 12-month fixed term contract.

 

Your primary responsibilities:

Build, train, and fine-tune AI/ML models for use cases including condition monitoring, computer vision, predictive maintenance, document intelligence, and GenAI automation.
Develop and deploy AI applications using Databricks, Python, n8n, and cloud-native tools.
Collaborate with Data Engineers to source, prepare, and label datasets.
Experience with DevOps practices and tools ideally Azure DevOps, Terraform Cloud, Azure & AWS
Design and implement MLOps workflows for version control, deployment, and monitoring.
Contribute to MinResAI (a ChatGPT-style interface) with LLM features such as RAG, summarisation, and workflow automation.

 

What is required

Bachelor’s or master’s in computer science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Certifications in cloud platforms (Azure, AWS), Databricks, or AI/ML technologies are desirable.
Extensive full stack development experience inclusive of AI Development experience in a business or industrial setting
Mining domain knowledge would be highly desirable
Hands-on experience with AWS or Azure, SQL, Python, ML frameworks, Databricks and n8n is essential
Familiarity with CI/CD for model deployment, and data pipelines.
Experience with CV models (e.g. YOLO, OpenCV) is desirable
​​Uses initiative, demonstrates resilience and a continuous improvement mindset and proactive approach to problem solving  
​​Understanding of system integration techniques and complexities​ ​ 

 

About Mineral Resources 

MinRes is a leading diversified resources company with extensive operations in lithium, iron ore, energy and mining services across Western Australia. With a focus on people and innovation, MinRes has become one of the ASX’s best-performing companies since listing in 2006. 

Our headquarters at 20 Walters Drive sets a new standard for workplace wellness.  World class facilities include a café, restaurant, commercial gym, crèche, daycare and health centre, including GP. 

At MinRes, the future's bright. Be part of our next chapter.

The Company

Harry The Hirer is Australia’s leading events company. For 40+ years, we’ve powered the country’s most iconic events: Australian Open, Formula 1 Grand Prix, MotoGP, Melbourne Cup.

Build and operate production-grade AI infrastructure that operators trust and the business depends on.

We compete on speed and quality. We’re building production AI systems that dramatically reduce turnaround times while maintaining our design excellence, the goal is to streamline and push the limits of what’s possible.

The Role

Define together with the company stakeholders  how a large organisation adopts AI, then build the frameworks that make it happen independently.

You’ll create the playbooks, blueprints, and self-service processes that let department managers identify, scope, and implement AI workflows .

This is strategic architecture with immediate execution. You shape the vision, then you ship it.

Success metrics: Departments use your playbooks independently - Future projects deploy using your templates - Demonstrated time savings and team adoption within first 3 months

Must Have

•          Designed solutions bridging business strategy and technical execution

•          Created frameworks that enabled organisational independence (not dependency)

•          Worked directly with stakeholders and managers on transformation initiatives

•          Built playbooks, templates, or systems others could use without you

•          Comfortable with tight scope control and explicit criteria

Nice to Have

•          Experience transforming non-tech industries through AI

•          Background in events, logistics, design, or creative production

•          Worked in owner-operated businesses

•          Deployed AI in resource-constrained environments

•          Built adoption frameworks with measurable ROI

About You

You are: - A systems thinker who ships production solutions, not theoretical diagrams - Energized by creating leverage through frameworks - Comfortable measuring success by adoption rates and time savings

Reality check: - This is an established company, not a startup - Architecture flows through a single point of authority - Regular leadership review with CEO/CFO - Trust earned through conservative rollouts and proven value - Priorities can shift based on business needs

Location: Melbourne (Abbotsford, on-site )
Start: ASAP

Great Permanent opportunity for a Data Architecture & Strategy Lead to join a high growth technology first Scale up based in Sydney, flexible hybrid role.
We’re partnering with a high growth, technology led financial services scale up that is investing heavily in its data platform to support the next phase of business growth, automation, and AI driven capability.

The Opportunity
This is a hands-on senior data leadership role where you will own data architecture and strategy end to end, with a clear mandate to fix foundational issues, modernise the data stack, and build the platform required to scale with confidence. If you enjoy solving hard data problems, making pragmatic architectural decisions, and balancing speed, cost, and long-term value, this role will suit you.

You will take ownership of the core data architecture and work closely with engineering, product, and business leaders to design and implement a modern, scalable data foundation. This role is execution focused and not purely advisory. You will be expected to design, build, and stabilise key components yourself.

You will also play a critical role in enabling future AI, automation, and advanced analytics use cases by ensuring the right data foundations, governance, and observability are in place.

What You’ll Be Doing

Data Architecture and Platform Strategy
• Own and evolve the overall data architecture and technical direction
• Make clear build vs buy decisions based on cost, latency, and business value
• Re architect legacy ETL and ELT pipelines to improve freshness, reliability, and cost efficiency

Automation and AI Enablement
• Design data ingestion and serving layers to support modern automation and AI workloads
• Account for latency and reliability requirements beyond traditional BI and reporting
• Prepare the data platform to support future RAG and agent-based use cases

Data Governance and Quality
• Establish practical data contracts with product and engineering teams
• Drive data quality ownership to the point of creation rather than downstream cleanup
• Implement data observability, lineage, and traceability to improve trust and explainability

Commercial and Cost Ownership
• Own data platform costs and vendor decisions
• Balance innovation with cost discipline and operational efficiency

What We’re Looking For

Strong experience in data architecture and hands on data engineering/ Science leadership
• Proven ability to modernise data platforms in scaling or complex environments
• Experience making pragmatic architectural decisions under real business constraints
• Solid understanding of modern data stacks, cloud data platforms, and automation
• Exposure to unstructured data, AI adjacent workloads, or advanced analytics is highly regarded
• Strong stakeholder management skills and the ability to influence without authority
• A lean, outcome focused mindset over technical perfection

Company Description


Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.

Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.

Where and how you can work

Our flagship campus is in Sydney. We also have a campus in Melbourne and co-working spaces in Brisbane, Perth, Adelaide and Auckland. But you have choice in where and how you work, we trust our Canvanauts to choose the balance that empowers them and their team to achieve their goals.

Job Description


What you’d be doing in this role

As Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that's all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you'll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve.

This role will see you:

Building world-class AI infrastructure to support a 100+ person research team at the forefront of creative AI

Designing and scaling multi-cloud systems that support high-performance model training and inference

Partnering across AWS, GCP, Cloudflare and GCore to optimise GPU compute environments

Enhancing CI/CD pipelines and developer velocity within our AI platform teams

Improving monitoring, alerting and system observability for AI workloads

Driving alignment in DevOps best practices across the AI platform and CORE engineering teams

Leading a high-impact engineering team in a fast-paced, cutting-edge environment

You're probably a match if

You’ve led DevOps or infrastructure teams, ideally in AI or high-performance computing environments

You’re experienced with AWS (ECS, EC2, S3, IAM) and multi-cloud environments like GCP, Cloudflare or GCore

You’ve worked with Kubernetes, SLURM, or similar distributed training infrastructure

You’re fluent in infrastructure as code tools like Terraform

You understand the lifecycle of AI models and how to support R&D at scale

You have a strong grasp of containerisation, Linux fundamentals, and cloud networking

You’re collaborative, curious, and passionate about enabling others to move fast and safely

About the team

You’ll be joining CORE (Canva Original Research & Exploration) — our in-house AI research lab. CORE brings together researchers, engineers, and infrastructure specialists to build world-class models that unlock creativity at scale. With over 100 researchers already in the team, this role is foundational to scaling our AI training and inference capabilities as we push the boundaries of what's possible in product-integrated AI.


What's in it for you?

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a range of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here's a taste of what's on offer:

Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too

Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers

An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more

Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

Other stuff to know

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva so even if you don’t feel like your skills quite match what’s listed above - we still want to hear from you!

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

This role offers an opportunity to work with global teams, provide technical guidance, and drive innovation in security architecture. As an Architect, you have an opportunity to drive the team with AI powered initiatives to enhance the productivity.

Develop a Requirement Definition Document (RDD), High-Level Design (HLD), and Low-Level Design (LLD).
Stay updated on customer architecture within the dedicated technical area and regional requirements.
Apply solution architecture standards, processes, and principles.
Define and develop the full scope of solutions, working across different teams and organizations to create effective outcomes.
Work effectively in diverse environments, leveraging best practices and industry knowledge to enhance products and services.
Drive projects with manageable risks and resource requirements or oversee small teams, managing day-to-day operations, resource allocation, and workload distribution.
Act as a key troubleshooter and subject-matter expert on the assigned product portfolio, including fulfilment, assurance, inventory, security, and assessment.

Assurance/NAC. 
Inventory UIV, Discovery and Reconciliation domain. 
SSO/Security product suites/NIAM. 
Analytics

Java, Python, Expect scripting, 
Dockers, Kubernetes, Microservices, Databases, Kafka
XML, XSLT, Data Parsing, 
SNMP, REST, SOAP, CORBA, LDAP, JMS, and FTP.
